thread.title: Kate Upton Covers Sports Illustrated's 2017 Swimsuit Issue, Doesn't Wear Actual Swimsuit
thread.title_full: Kate Upton Covers Sports Illustrated's 2017 Swimsuit Issue, Doesn't Wear Actual Swimsuit

author: Sally Holmes
title: Kate Upton Covers Sports Illustrated's 2017 Swimsuit Issue, Doesn't Wear Actual Swimsuit
text:
Kate Upton Covered the Sports Illustrated 2017 Swimsuit Issue Without Wearing an Actual Swimsuit 
She's pretty much naked, really. Most Popular By Sally Holmes Feb 15, 2017 Last night, Jimmy Kimmel unveiled Sports Illustrated 's 2017 swimsuit issue cover with the cover model herself: Kate Upton. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Upton appears on three different covers of the swimsuit issue, though, strangely, she doesn't actually wear a full swimsuit in any of them. In one, she's wearing a bikini bottom and a sequined moto jacket: Most Popular In the next, she's just wearing ropeâ€•and not even strategically placed rope (hi boobs!). "I just washed upon the shore and have to be crafty," she said. It's pretty much just rope: And the last one is just Kate Upton wearing a whole lot of jewelry, including a fancy belt, that is actually the opposite of what you should wear in the ocean: All that said, the model looks gorgeous on all three covers (hello, it's Kate Upton), and she shared them on her Instagram, expressing thanks to SI . A post shared by Kate Upton (@kateupton) on Feb 14, 2017 at 9:53pm PST This isn't the first time Upton has graced the Swimsuit Issue, cover of course. She made her appearance in the mag in its 2011 issue and then landed the cover spot (in an actual swimsuit) in 2012: And then again in chillier climate, yet semi-naked (get it, "polar bare") in 2013:
